qas.question: What type of structure is the falekaupule?
Besides meetings, for what other use is the meeting hall used?
Aside from being defined as a meeting hall, what other definition does falekaupule have?
What is the traditional use of the falekaupule?
What is the traditional customs and culture on Tuvalu?

context: Another important building is the falekaupule or maneapa the traditional island <a0_0>meeting hall<a0_0/>, where important matters are discussed and which is also used for wedding <a1_0>celebrations<a1_0/> and community activities such as a fatele involving music, singing and dancing. Falekaupule is also used as the name of the <a2_0>council of elders<a2_0/> – the traditional <a3_0>decision making body<a3_0/> on each island. Under the Falekaupule Act, Falekaupule means "traditional assembly in each island...composed in accordance with the Aganu of each island". <a4_0>Aganu<a4_0/> means traditional customs and culture.
